description: The function 'create_area_model' generates a table visualization of an area model, typically used in mathematics to illustrate multiplication and division concepts. The table is dynamically sized based on the content, and it can accommodate a variety of data types, including integers, fractions, decimals, and unknown values represented by question marks.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Area Model Tables
stimulus_type_specification.description: The 'create_area_model' function can generate table visualizations of area models. It accepts inputs of type 'Dimensions' and 'Headers', which define the structure and content of the area model. The 'Dimensions' class specifies the number of columns and rows in the area model, while the 'Headers' class defines the decomposed pieces of the product or dividend to be displayed on the top and left side of the area model. The function is designed to accommodate a variety of data types, including integers, fractions, decimals, and unknown values represented by question marks. This function is particularly useful for illustrating multiplication and division concepts in an educational setting.

details: The 'Dimensions' class has two key input fields: 'columns' and 'rows', which control the number of columns and rows in the area model respectively.

The 'Headers' class has two key input fields: 'columns' and 'rows', which define the decomposed pieces of the product or dividend to be displayed on the top and left side of the area model respectively.
All fields in the 'Dimensions' and 'Headers' classes are required.
The 'Headers' class validates the input headers using a regular expression pattern that allows single letters, numbers, fractions, decimals, and question marks.
The 'Dimensions' class does not have any explicit validation rules, but it implicitly requires the 'columns' and 'rows' fields to be integers.
The function generates a table visualization of an area model, with the headers displayed on the top and left side of the table.
The size of the table and the cells within it are dynamically calculated based on the content.
The content of the table cells is determined by the 'data' field of the 'stim_desc' object, which is not explicitly defined in the provided code.

educational_standards.description: Solve word problems that require multiplying 2-digit numbers by 2-digit numbers.

educational_standards.display_name: Setting Up Multiplication with Area Models
educational_standards.description: Represent a multi-digit multiplication as the area of a rectangle partitioned into smaller rectangles; label each partial area and add to obtain the full area (partial-products model).
Multiply 1-digit numbers by 2-digit numbers using area models.

educational_standards.display_name: Multiplying 2-Digit Numbers by 2-Digit Numbers Using Area Models
educational_standards.description: Multiply 2-digit numbers by 2-digit numbers using area models.

educational_standards.display_name: Multiply a 2-Digit Number by a 2-Digit Number
educational_standards.description: Multiply a 2-digit number by a 2-digit number.
Solve word problems that require multiplying 1-digit numbers by 2-digit or 3-digit numbers.
Divide 2-digit numbers by 1-digit numbers without remainders.
Multiply a decimal by a two-digit whole number using area models.

educational_standards.display_name: Decimal Addition and Subtraction Word Problems
educational_standards.description: Solve word problems involving additing and subtracting with decimal numbers.
Divide decimals to hundredths by a whole number.
